==Carl Costello==
==Carl Costello==
{{Main|Carl Costello}}
{{Main|Carl Costello}}
â
'''Carl Costello''', played by former ''[[Emmerdale]]'' actor [[Paul Opacic]], made his first on-screen appearance on 19 July 2010.<ref>{{citenews|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s13/hollyoaks/spoilers/a234167/2866-carmels-stunned-by-theresas-revelation.html|title=2866: Carmel's stunned by Theresa's revelation|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi MÃ©dias|Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|first=Daniel|last=Kilkelly|date=19 July 2010|accessdate=2010-12-01}}</ref> Opacic's casting was announced on 12 April 2010.<ref name="raft">{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s13/hollyoaks/news/a213947/hollyoaks-announces-raft-of-new-castings.html|title='Hollyoaks' announces raft of new castings |first=Kris|last=Green|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi MÃ©dias|Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|date=12 April 2010|accessdate=2010-12-01}}</ref> He is the husband of [[Heidi Costello|Heidi]] ([[Kim Tiddy]]) and the father of [[Jem Costello|Jem]] (Helen Russell-Clark), [[Riley Costello|Riley]] (Rob Norbury), [[Seth Costello|Seth]] (Miles Higson)<ref name="raft"/> and [[Jasmine Costello|Jasmine]] ([[Victoria Atkin]]).<ref name="jas">{{cite web|last=Green|first=Kris|title='Hollyoaks' to tackle Gender Dysphoria|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s13/hollyoaks/news/a234896/hollyoaks-to-tackle-gender-dysphoria.html|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=([[Hachette Filipacchi MÃ©dias|Hachette Filipacchi UK]])|accessdate=2010-12-01|date=01 July 2010}}</ref> Carl has been described as a "self-assured smooth operator who's charming, but will play things underhand".<ref>{{cite web|title=Carl Costello (played by Paul Opacic)|url=http://www.e4.com/hollyoaks/cast/boys/carlcostello.html|work=[[E4 (channel){{!}}E4]]|publisher=([[Channel 4{{!}}Channel 4 Television Corporation]])|accessdate=2010-11-14|date=July 2010<!-- |archiveurl=http://www.webcitation.org/5uEimjdpE|archivedate=14 November 2010 -->}}</ref>
+
'''Carl Costello''', played by former ''[[Emmerdale]]'' actor [[Paul Opacic]], made his first on-screen appearance on 19 July 2010.<ref>{{citenews|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s13/hollyoaks/spoilers/a234167/2866-carmels-stunned-by-theresas-revelation.html|title=2866: Carmel's stunned by Theresa's revelation|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi MÃ©dias|Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|first=Daniel|last=Kilkelly|date=19 July 2010|accessdate=2010-12-01}}</ref> Opacic's casting was announced on 12 April 2010.<ref name="raft">{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s13/hollyoaks/news/a213947/hollyoaks-announces-raft-of-new-castings.html|title='Hollyoaks' announces raft of new castings |first=Kris|last=Green|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi MÃ©dias|Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|date=12 April 2010|accessdate=2010-12-01}}</ref> He is the husband of [[Heidi Costello|Heidi]] ([[Kim Tiddy]]) and the father of [[Jem Costello|Jem]] (Helen Russell-Clark), [[Riley Costello|Riley]] (Rob Norbury), [[Seth Costello|Seth]] (Miles Higson)<ref name="raft"/> and [[Jasmine Costello|Jasmine]] ([[Victoria Atkin]]).<ref name="jas">{{cite web|last=Green|first=Kris|title='Hollyoaks' to tackle Gender Dysphoria|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/s13/hollyoaks/news/a234896/hollyoaks-to-tackle-gender-dysphoria.html|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=([[Hachette Filipacchi MÃ©dias|Hachette Filipacchi UK]])|accessdate=2010-12-01|date=01 July 2010}}</ref> Carl has been described as a "self-assured smooth operator who's charming, but will play things underhand".<ref>{{cite web|title=Carl Costello (played by Paul Opacic)|url=http://www.e4.com/hollyoaks/cast/boys/carlcostello.html|work=[[E4 (channel){{!}}E4]]|publisher=([[Channel 4{{!}}Channel 4 Television Corporation]])|accessdate=2010-11-14|date=July 2010<!-- |archiveurl=http://www.webcitation.org/5uEimjdpE|archivedate=14 November 2010 -->}}</ref>
